author: Special Correspondent
text:
Functionaries of parties constituting People’s Welfare Movement staging a demonstration decrying delay on the part of the City Corporation in implementing Underground Drainage project in Erode on Monday.— PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Leaders representing constituents of People’s Welfare Front led a demonstration on Monday assailing the City Corporation for what they termed as its failure to complete the Underground Drainage project.

Injuries

The dug-up roads were the causes for grievous injuries of the public, especially children and elders, the leaders of four constituent parties of the Front: Marumalarchi Dravid Munnetra Kazhagam, CPI, CPI (M) and Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi, said.

A. Ganeshamoorthy, former Erode MP and district secretary of MDMK, presided over the demonstration addressed by S. Muthusamy, CPI (M) district secretary, K.R. Thirunavakarasu, CPI district secretary, and N. Vinayagamoorthy of VCK, Corporation Councillor.

Difficulties

The leaders also drew attention of the Health Department to difficulties caused to patients at the Government Headquarters Hospitals due to unfilled vacancies, and inadequacy of manpower to utilise X-ray, scan and other equipment.

Patients faced the ignominy of rushing to Salem or Coimbatore for treatment, they said.
title: PWF criticises Corpn. over incompletion of UGD project
